Journal Story: Have most of my gear and have been doing some bikes preparing the legs. My daughter and granddaughter were here and they getting their gear ready.  3 weeks to go.
did a hike of 6 1\2 miles today.  Felt good
did a hike of 6 1\2 miles today.  Felt good
did a practice hike of 6.5 miles

Sandy went with me today on my practice hike.  We had a good walk.  There is a steep decline so I desided to take a side trail thinking it would not be as steep.  WRONG.  It circled back.  Still had to go down steep incline.  Was careful and Sandy made it.  Met a person who is also going on a section hike later this summer.

Wanted arrange pack as it should be (possibly) and do a pre-hike.  The pack including food and liter of water was 31.5#'s.  Will go thru to check on items to eliminate.  Would like to be below 30#'s.  I did 10 miles today. It was muddy and water part of the trail.  Felt good.  Nice breeze.   Think I am about ready.  Will leave Knoxville Sunday for Springer Mtn.  Will start week from today and head for Clingman's Dome 5

went on a hike today.  Meet a couple of people that were also preparing for hikes.  One person getting ready to go to Yosemite to hike and another was going to NC.  In the past they had hiked some of the same trails here in TN.  Only did 7.5 miles today.  Going thru the pack to see if can get below 30lbs.
packed the pack, have all my gear and food.  Pack weight was 32lbs.  Feel like I am ready.  Should be at trail head Monday.

we got to the lodge late yesterday .  My daughter and granddaughter got here and got checked in.  We got our pictures taken at the arch.  Went to the overlook for the falls.  Have meet about 4 other hikers that are leaving also today.   We went thru our packs and repacked checking things.   Slept well.  Time to eat a good breakfast and hike out later.

Made it to Black Gap Shelter today.Pitched our tents with about 10 other hikers. We were warned by them that there are too many mice in the shelter to sleep there. Enjoying the time today hiking with my daughter and granddaughter(who is 12).

Kelli, Katie and I  left about 8:30 on the Approach Trail.   We did not take the stairs but went up the trail beside it.  Enjoyed the hike, got yo go across a water crossing on a log bridge. The trail was good.  Not to many rocks  just enough to make it interesting.  Got to the shelter and set up out tents.  Talked to several hikers, some were thru hikers but most were section.  Talked with Data, he had thru hiked in  2014.  Talked with Lefty.  Lefty was interesting  had been in the Army were he lost his right arm, part of left hand and knee cap.  Katie got to talk to a college grad with his dog.

we had our morning oatmeal and coffee (katie had her's also).  Had some elevation gain but mostly down today but was very rocky and Katie's feet started to bother her.  Made the shelter most of the people we had met the night before was there and a few new people.  The lady that we had met at Amocola Falls from Maine was there.  She had decided to go home.  Kelli and I discussed them leaving since Katie's feet were bothering her some.  The lady from Maine offered to take them back to Amocola Falls the next.  Katie did get to know Willie (the dog of the college grad) a little more.  He is a very nice dog.  Gone to bed by 8 pm

After good oatmeal and breakdown headed out.  Kelli and Katie left me about .5 miles to head home.  Was fun having them there.  Glad Katie didn't try Sassafras Mtn with feet bother her.  It was a rocky climb to the top.  A rough but beautiful day.

Some good oatmeal for breakfast.  A lot of up and down.  Trail was rocky today.  My feet which seemed to hurt some at the start of trail now seem to have got to and no longer an issue.  Talking to Data and Roster has been interesting.  Have also meet different couples they were hiking one for thru hike and the to say they hiked part of the trail.

stayed at campsite before area requiring bear container.  From here will be going over Blood Mtn.  Was nice climb and from the summit had some beautiful views.  A lot of day hikers come up from Neel Gap for the views.  Going down the mtn was rough lot of boulder climbing over.  Had my first rain.  Put rain gear on the pack but didn't think it would rain much (wrong) got soaked.   When got to the gap got 2 cold Mr. Pibbs.  Boy they were good.  Got shower and talked to Lefty  and Data.  This is were people throw boots into the tree forgot to take a picture.   Had one of best cheeseburgers (2) I had ever had that night.

left hostel.  Most of Trail Family got.off trail here.   Had a lot of steep up and downs.  Was a lot of boulders was a long day and rough day.  Lot of nice views but phone went down.   Enjoyed the day.  Felt some chaffing coming on did some doctoring how to prevent serious issue.

Had my oatmeal  and Cliff bar.  a hiker that came from north said easy walk.  It was for first two miles.  Things changed.  Lot of boulders and a couple steep climbs.  Feel chafing.   When got to the parking lot.  Phone dead. Bobby K.  Arrived called for shuttle.  A couple pickups pulled into parking lot.. I asked if one would bring us to Helen.  Guess one feit sorry for me seeing I was hurting.  Gave us a ride to town.  Chafing  was bad
wii leave the trail.   Thr chafing is badSorry to leave the trail will miss everyone.  Had fun and enjoyed.   Good luck everyone. Praying  for you.
